item.title: Switch Port Attributes
item.description: Cumulus Linux exposes network interfaces for several types of physical and logical devices: lo, network loopback device ethN, switch management port(s), for out of band management only swpN, switch front panel ports (optional) brN, bridges (IEEE 802.1Q VLANs) (optional) bondN, bonds (IEEE 802.3ad link aggregation trunks, or port channels) Each physical network interface has a number of configurable settings: Auto-negotiation Duplex

item.title: ifplugd
item.description: ifplugd is an Ethernet link-state monitoring daemon, that can execute user-specified scripts to configure an Ethernet device when a cable is plugged in, or automatically unconfigure it when a cable is removed. Follow the steps below to install and configure the ifplugd daemon.
